"step_by_step_thinking": "The article mentions that fetal goitrous hypothyroidism can occur in maternal hyperthyroidism. In this case, the mother likely had inadequate iodine intake. Congenital hypothyroidism is associated with negative impact on the developing fetal brain and lack of normal myelination. The article also mentions that thyroid hormone deficiency may have a negative impact on the developing central nervous system. Since the child has congenital hypothyroidism, we can expect symptoms related to this condition.

Considering the options, Hypotonia (A) is expected as it is associated with congenital hypothyroidism. Diarrhea (B) and Umbilical hernia (C) are not specifically mentioned in relation to congenital hypothyroidism, so they would NOT be expected to be observed in this child.

Macroglossia (D) is a condition characterized by an enlarged tongue, which is not typically associated with congenital hypothyroidism. Although it's possible that the child could have other conditions causing macroglossia, it's not directly related to congenital hypothyroidism.",
"answer_choice": "B"
